alerts.danger-depth-exceeds-zone: The danger's depth may not exceed the zone's depth nor can a danger have a depth > 0 when a zone's depth is infinite (equal to 0).
alerts.no-trigger-if-not-on-combat-scene: Danger Zones do not trigger while you are not active on the current combat scene.
alerts.select-zone-start: Select a start location for this zone. Selected area will snap to grid and represent the top left corner of this zone.
alerts.select-zone-end: Select an end location for this zone. Selected area will snap to grid and represent the lower right corner of this zone.
alerts.select-target: Select a location in the zone. Selected area will snap to grid and represent the top left corner of the danger's target.
alerts.user-selection-exited: You have exited from danger location selection prematurely. Zone trigger execution stopped.

edit-form.actor.label: Actor
edit-form.allInArea.label: Target All Tokens in Danger
edit-form.allInArea.description: If more than one token is in a target area, they will all be targeted. Otherwise only one random token is targeted.
edit-form.bleed.label: Bleed
edit-form.bleed.description: If set, the danger's boundary (based on its width, height and depth) can partially exceed this zone's boundary. Danger effects will span into the bleed but tokens that are not in the zone boundary will not be targeted in the bleed. This ensures that each grid in the zone has an equal chance of being randomly targeted. If not set, units closer to the zone's center will have a greater likelihood of being targeted.

boundary.bottom.label: Bottom
boundary.end.label: End:
boundary.label: Dimensions
boundary.description: This zone's dimensions encompass the grids that stretch between the given start and end positions and the elevations between the given bottom and up to, but not including, the top. If the bottom and top numbers are the same then the zone is considered to have infinite depth.
boundary.start.label: Start:
boundary.top.label: Top
boundary.x.label: x
boundary.y.label: y

edit-form.enabled.label: Active
edit-form.initiative-count.label: Count
edit-form.flavor.label: Flavor
edit-form.flavor.description: This text will output to a chat message when this zone triggers.
edit-form.light.replace.label: Ambient Lighting
edit-form.light.replace.description: Choose what to do with existing ambient light when this zone triggers.
edit-form.likelihood.label: Likelihood
edit-form.likelihood.description: Set the likelihood that a danger's effects will execute on zone trigger.
edit-form.loop.label: Loop Count
edit-form.loop.description: Set the number of danger executions when this zone is triggered. Each loop will have the likelihood assessed separately when executed.
edit-form.name: Configure Zone
edit-form.other.label: Other Settings
edit-form.placeTemplate.label: Choose Location
edit-form.placeTemplate.description: On trigger, you will be prompted to select the scene location to target with the danger (otherwise the location is randomly selected from within the bounds of the zone and bleed). If the location that you select is fully outside of the zone, the danger effects will generate but tokens outside of the zone will not be targeted.
edit-form.random.label: Randomize
edit-form.random.description: All zones in this scene that share the same trigger are grouped and only one is triggered at random. Assign a weight to control how often one triggers in relation to the others.
edit-form.replace.label: Lasting Effects
edit-form.replace.description: Choose what to do with existing lasting effects when this zone triggers.
edit-form.runUntilTokenFound.label: Always Hits a Token
edit-form.runUntilTokenFound.description: The danger will target an area of the zone where at least one token is present, if able.
edit-form.single-run.description: This section executes at most once, after the first likelihood success, and regardless of the loop count for this zone
edit-form.stretch.description: Adjusts the danger's area of effect so that the stretch location remains fixed while the zone's top and bottom still constrict the possible initial target. 'Ground' uses 0 as the final bottom and 'Sky' uses 99999 as the final top. Example: Given 'rising from bottom' in a zone with bottom=2, top=10, and danger depth=3, and an initial target of bottom=5/top=8. The stretch will keep the top target = 8 but drop the bottom to 2, which equals the bottom of the zone.
edit-form.stretch.label: Stretch
edit-form.title.label: Title
edit-form.token-targeting.label: Token Targeting
edit-form.token-disposition.label: Disposition
edit-form.trigger.label: Trigger
edit-form.type.label: Danger
edit-form.weight.label: Weight

import.title: Import Dangers
import.noFile: You did not upload a data file!
import.error: failed import due to invalid data
import.skipped: skipped because id is duplicate of an existing danger.

light.replace-types.A.label: Clear all ambient lighting
light.replace-types.N.label: Retain all ambient lighting
light.replace-types.R.label: Clear lights that share this trigger
light.replace-types.T.label: Clear lights that share this danger
light.replace-types.Z.label: Clear lights that share this zone

replace-types.A.label: Clear all lasting effects
replace-types.N.label: Retain all lasting effects
replace-types.R.label: Clear effects that share this trigger
replace-types.T.label: Clear effects that share this danger
replace-types.Z.label: Clear effects that share this zone

scene.description: Add danger zone effects to this scene (this will cause form refresh so save any scene changes before proceeding).
scene.label: Danger Zone
scene.random-trigger.label: Random Manual Trigger
scene.title: Title

setting.chat-details-to-gm.label: Chat Zone Details to GM on Trigger
setting.chat-details-to-gm.description: Will send a private chat message to GM that includes details on the danger zone on trigger, such as target location, eligible tokens, and targeted tokens.
setting.danger-zone-types-config.name: Dangers
setting.danger-zone-types-config.label: Configure Dangers
setting.display-danger-boundary.label: Highlight Danger Target Area
setting.display-danger-boundary.description: Temporarily highlights the area targeted by a danger when the zone is triggered (GM's session only).
setting.scene-control-button-display.label: Display Clear Lasting Effects Button
setting.scene-control-button-display.description: Toggles the display of the Clear Danger Zone Lasting Effects button within the scene control buttons tiles grouping
setting.scene-control-light-button-display.label: Display Clear Ambient Light Button
setting.scene-control-light-button-display.descr: Toggles the display of the Clear Ambient Light button within the scene control buttons lighting control grouping
setting.scene-trigger-button-display.label: Zone Trigger Display Location
setting.scene-trigger-button-display.description: Set the location where the zone triggers will display. Triggers only display for the GM when viewing the active scene.
setting.types-button-display.label: Display Dangers Button
setting.types-button-display.description: Toggles the display of the Dangers button at the bottom of the scenes side bar
setting.scene-enabled-default.label: New Zone Active by Default
setting.scene-enabled-default.description: Select whether or not new danger zones default to active when you first create them.
setting.token-depth-multiplier.label: Token Depth Multiplier
setting.token-depth-multiplier.description: For purposes of zone depth targeting, set a multiplier that calculates how tall a token is in relation to the scene distance, the token's scale, and the number of grid squares that that token takes up. A token in a single grid square with a scale of 1.0, a scene distance of 5, and a multiplier of 1.2 will have a tallness of 6 (1 * 1.0 * 5 * 1.2).
setting.zone-exclusion-tag.label: Block Zone Tag
setting.zone-exclusion-tag.description: Enter the tag that you will use to indicate that a wall, light, tile, token or drawing blocks the occupied grid from being included in the zone. Note that the 'Tagger' module is required or, for drawings, using this as the Text Label also works.

active-effect.confirm: Are you sure you want to clear the active effect data?
active-effect.label: Active Effect
active-effect.notes: Active effect will be transferred to each danger target.
active-effect.edit.title: Edit Active Effect
active-effect.delete.title: Delete Active Effect
active-effect.cleared.info: Active effect data has been deleted from this danger.

type-form.animation.label: Animation
type-form.area-x.label: Width
type-form.area-y.label: Height
type-form.area-z.label: Depth
type-form.dimensions.label: Dimensions
type-form.dimensions.notes: For depth, specify the difference in grid units between the top and bottom elevations. A depth of 0 will default to the zone's depth.

fluidCanvas.delay.label: Delay
fluidCanvas.duration.label: Duration
fluidCanvas.intensity.label: Intensity
fluidCanvas.iteration.label: Iteration
fluidCanvas.label: Kandashi's Fluid Canvas
fluidCanvas.type.label: Type
fluidCanvas.notes: Invokes Fluid Canvas effects at the start of the danger effect.

type-form.icon.label: Icon
type-form.macro.label: Macro
type-form.macro.notes: The macro in this world that will run when the danger zone triggers.

monks-active-tiles.label: Monk's Active Tiles
monks-active-tiles.notes: These triggers will be added to the tile that is created by the lasting effect.

type-form.name.label: Name

token-says.compendium.label: Compendium
token-says.label: Token Says
token-says.notes: Trigger Token Says functionality on danger targets for a given playlist or rolltable source. Entering a data into 'Token Says' field will always say that thing or play that playlist's track, otherwise the source data is randomized.
token-says.rule-type.label: Type
token-says.says.label: Token Says
token-says.source.label: Source

warpgate.actor.label: Name
warpgate.duplicates.label: Duplicates
warpgate.delay.label: Delay
warpgate.isRolltable.label: Is Rolltable
warpgate.label: Warp Gate
warpgate.notes: Spawn creatures using the actor name or, if 'Is Rolltable' is checked, spawn will be random actor matching name pulled from the specified rolltable in this world.
